de.iabg.mode
Class DefaultModeModel

java.lang.Object
  de.iabg.mode.DefaultModeModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
ModeModel, Loggable
public class DefaultModeModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements ModeModel

This implementation of ModeModel attempts to create all the functionality described in the ModeModel class description. Refer to the class API for more details. Because the aim of this model is to represent the mode shapes in a tabular form, the mode data has been wrapped in another object, called ModeTableModel, which implements TableModel and is ready to be added to a Swing component. Therefore most of the mehtods in this class simply wrap methods from ModeTableModel.

Version:
September 12, 2008
Author:
Adam C. Dick, BSE

Constructor Detail

DefaultModeModel

public DefaultModeModel(JModePanel modePanel)
Constructs a default DefaultModeModel with no stored data. This constructor also initializes all the storage objects, which should not be destroyed during the life of this object. This is because listeners may register themselves to these objects, and will not receive notifications if the references to these objects are changed. This constructor also stores a reference to the JModePanel, so that this model has access to all the methods of that component.

Parameters:
modePanel - the JModePanel that this model is designed for
